title: Police: 4 adults, 1 child shot in Evanston
content:
CINCINNATI —
Police are investigating after four adults and a 3-year-old were shot in Evanston Monday.
Investigators said a car drove by the 1700 block of Hewitt Avenue around 8:30 p.m. and opened fire.
Officials said they found five victims, including a 3-year-old boy who was hit in the leg.
Cincinnati Police Department Interim Chief Eliot Isaac said all injuries are non-life-threatening.
Witnesses said they heard gunshots then a car speeding off.
Investigators said some of the victims took themselves to the hospital.
Detectives are still trying to figure out if the victims are related.
"It's a senseless act, anyone who would do such a thing is senseless. I mean I don't know any other way to describe it. It's a senseless act and we're going to do everything we can to resolve it," Isaac said.
Police are looking for a dark-colored car involved in the shooting.
Anyone with information is asked to call police.
